How can I convert a binary number represented as a string to its decimal equivalent in Ruby?
For example, if I have the binary string "1111000", how can I convert it to decimal using Ruby code?

In Ruby, you can easily convert a binary string to its decimal equivalent using the `to_i` method with a base of 2. Here's how you can do it:

```ruby
binary_string = "1111000"
decimal_number = binary_string.to_i(2)

puts decimal_number
```

In this code, `binary_string.to_i(2)` converts the binary string `"1111000"` to a decimal number by interpreting it as a base-2 number. The result will be `120`, which is the decimal equivalent of the binary number `1111000`.
